sentence.Network_cn: 折磨菲尔的人嘲讽地哼了一声。

sentence.Network_en: She grinned derisively while I seethed with rage.
sentence.Network_cn: 我怒火中烧，她却嘲弄地咧着嘴笑。

sentence.Network_en: This answer came derisively from several places at the same instant.
sentence.Network_cn: 好几个人都不约而同地以讥讽的口吻作出回答.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 冰与火之歌单词 - 豆丁网 ... derision 嘲笑，笑柄 derisively 嘲笑地，嘲弄地 descend 降,传,降临.

list.abs: derisive laughter , booing , etc., 嘲弄的笑声 , 嘘声等.
an object of scorn or derision ., 藐视或嘲笑的对象.
it was an acute one for certain American writers cherished democracy but whose work lay exposed to popular derision .对于某些热爱民主而作品广受公众嘲笑的美国作家，的确是一个严重问题。
People gives out derisive sound ., 人们都发出嘲笑声.

entry.def: A derisive noise, expression, or remark expresses contempt.

example.ex: There was a short, derisive laugh.
example.tran: 有人短促、嘲弄地笑了一声。

means.word_mean: 1. in a disrespectful and mocking manner;

auth_sentence.content: I would walk in and derisively submit to my mother's kiss.
auth_sentence.res_content: I would walk in and derisively submit to my mother's kiss.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I would walk in and derisively submit to my mother's kiss.

auth_sentence.content: No one knows precisely when or how niger turned derisively into nigger and attained a pejorative meaning.
